title: Graziano: Don't be surprised if these 32 things happen, from an MVP run to rookies who could star
content: Jordan Love in the MVP mix? Emeka Egbuka leading all Bucs receivers? Colts winning the AFC South? We have 32 outside-the-box things to watch.

title: Ohtani takes big leap, earns win in 5-inning gem
content: Dodgers two-way star Shohei Ohtani completed five innings for the first time this season, holding the Reds to one run to earn his first win of the season Wednesday night.

title: Staley met with Knicks, would've taken HC job
content: Had the Knicks offered their head coaching job to South Carolina women's coach Dawn Staley, who interviewed for the position, she said she would have taken it.

title: Townsend-Ostapenko ends in heated net exchange
content: US Open opponents Taylor Townsend and Jelena Ostapenko got into a face-to-face argument on the Court 11 sideline right after Townsend won their second-round match 7-5, 6-1 on Wednesday.

title: McLean spins gem, makes history in Mets' sweep
content: Nolan McLean became the first New York Mets pitcher to win his first three major league starts, tossing eight magnificent innings in a 6-0 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies that completed a three-game sweep.

title: Aces roll to 12th straight win on Wilson's 34 points
content: Behind A'ja Wilson's 34 points, the Aces continued their torrid August, beating the Dream 81-75 for their franchise-record-tying 12th straight win.

title: Messi's magic fires Miami into Leagues Cup final
content: Inter Miami advanced to the Leagues Cup final with a 3-1 victory over Orlando City on Wednesday night, thanks to two goals from a returning Lionel Messi.

title: Suns sued by minority owners over records access
content: Suns minority owners Andy Kohlberg and Scott Selding have filed a lawsuit against the team, alleging that owner Mat Ishbia has refused access to internal records.

title: Three Rangers with 5 RBIs in 20-3 rout of Angels
content: Adolis Garcia, Joc Pederson and Kyle Higashioka each hit three-run homers and had five RBIs as the Rangers blew out the Angels 20-3.

title: ✍ Schefter's fantasy football cheat sheet

content: With the 2025 season a week away, NFL teams were required to finalize their 53-man rosters. We rounded up every team's cuts here.

content: Ruben Amorim and Manchester United arrived in Grimsby keen to start winning again. Instead, they made history with their latest low point.

content: This is the group put together in an offseason as undoubtedly a priority to rebuild the quarterback room.

content: Pamela Maldonado tracks the odds for the Heisman Trophy and the national champion and her best value bets.

content: Let's take an early look at a UFC event at the White House in 2026 that Dana White says is "going to happen."

title: Welcome to Necaxa: Rob, Ryan and Eva bring the Wrexham playbook to Mexico
content: Rob Mac and Ryan Reynolds have already written a Hollywood script with Wrexham's rise. With Eva Longoria, can they do it again with Necaxa in Mexico?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Fernandes linked with move to MLS, Saudi

title: From market rate to intermediaries, seven truths about the transfer market
content: The big clubs have the spending power and influence, but there are plenty of ways teams like Genoa can keep pace.

title: 'I was just lightheaded': Ravens showcase reactions of undrafted rookies who made team's roster
content: Three players produced a range of reactions when being informed of the good news that they made the Baltimore Ravens 53-man roster.

title: Way-Too-Early Bracketology: Is this (finally) the year of the Big Ten?
content: For a change, the Big Ten has both quantity and quality to send to the Dance. Can its 25-year title drought finally end?

title: NASCAR's playoff king, Joey Logano, wants derided format to stay
content: The is a vocal crowd within NASCAR unhappy with the the playoff format. Not Joey Logano, though, who has come to thrive in the biggest moments.

content: He made this announcement at the groundbreaking ceremony (bhumi puja) of the rocket launch pad, at Kulasekarapattinam

title: ‘Pookkalam’ gets a 3D makeover by Bengaluru-based Malayali designer
content: Rahul R, hailing from Kottayam, creates pookkalams with moving handcrafted components such as snake boats and eyes of Kathakali dancers, bringing his twist to the age-old tradition

title: Jammu-Srinagar national highway shut due to landslides in Udhampur
content: The 270-km-long stretch, the only all-weather road linking Kashmir with the rest of the country, was blocked by multiple landslides at several places between Jakheni and Chenani in Udhampu

title: Three men from West Bengal arrested for online stock trading scam, swindling over ₹1.6 crore from victims in Tamil Nadu

content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath also directed officials to ensure that the mortal remains of the victims reach their native places as soon as possible

content: NHRC issued notices to the Director General of Police (DGP) of Uttar Pradesh and the District Magistrate of Ghaziabad, calling for a detailed report on the matter within two weeks

title: Government extends duty-free imports of cotton by three months till December 31

content: A five-judge Constitution Bench of the Supreme Court, headed by Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai is hearing on the Presidential Reference

title: Google Maps misroute leads to tragedy, 3 killed as family van swept away in river
content: The incident occurred on Tuesday when a family was returning from a religious trip to Bhilwara and attempted to cross a closed culvert over the river

title: Indian Army mobilised for flood relief operations in Telangana’s Medak district
content: According to data from the Telangana Development Planning Society (TGDPS), Argonda in Kamareddy district recorded 44 cm of rainfall between 8 a.m. on August 27 and 7 a.m. on August 28.

content: In Punjab, which is under the grip of a massive flood after days of heavy rains, the NDRF, the Army, and other agencies have intensified their rescue efforts

title: Maoists kill teacher in Sukma; civilian toll in Bastar region at around 30 so far in 2025
content: A motive was not immediately clear, but Maoists often target civilians and villagers whom they suspect of acting as informers for police.

title: Kulasekarapattinam launch complex expected to be ready by December 2026: ISRO Chief

title: Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone booked in Bharatpur for 'defective' car
content: The complaint names Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone, citing their role as Hyundai brand ambassadors.

title: Vote theft in Congress' DNA: Haryana CM Saini
content: With Congress amplifying its allegation of "vote theft", Nayab Singh Saini launched a strong offensive against the grand old party.

title: Uddhav visits Raj's home in Mumbai on Ganesh Chaturthi; Fadnavis also drops in later
content: Raj Thackeray hosts Lord Ganesh at his residence, 'Shivtirth', located in the city's Dadar area, every year.

title: Jitendra Singh launches India’s first National Biofoundry Network
content: Science and Technology Minister Jitendra Singh said the BioE3 Policy looked towards the future and was not limited to research and innovation only.

title: Secondary, tertiary effects of U.S. tariffs on economy pose challenges: Finance Ministry report
content: Ongoing India-U.S. trade negotiations are critical in addressing these issues, including the secondary and tertiary effects of high tariff by the US on Indian goods, the monthly economic review released by the Finance Ministry said.

title: Fake cop nabbed driving beacon top car, wearing police uniform in Rajasthan's Dholpur
content: The man introduced himself as an ADG of the "National Security Cop" and produced four different identity cards.

title: Injured tiger 'Chhota Matka' rescued from Tadoba reserve
content: The T-126 killed rival big cat T-158 on May 12-13, but sustained severe injuries, Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve's field director stated in a release

title: Mizoram Assembly passes Bill to prohibit beggary
content: Social Welfare, Women and Child Development Minister Lalrinpuii said there are concerns that beggary is increasing in Mizoram, although the state is very fortunate to have very few beggars

title: Kamal Haasan bats for self-reliance as Trump’s 50% tariff kicks in
content: The Rajya Sabha MP said the 50% tariffs on our exporters were not about trade, nor about Ukraine but a political cudgel, “aimed at shaking our resolve”.

title: First ever under-lights cricket tournament at militancy-hotbed Pulwama try to heal old wounds
content: The first match between the Royal Goodwill and the Sultan Warriors was a nail-biter, with the final over getting to decide the winner

title: Amoebic meningoencephalitis: Kerala Health Department invokes State Public Health Act
content: So far, 41 cases of amoebic meningoencephalitis have been reported in the State this year, with 18 active cases in hospitals under treatment

title: Disproportionate assets case: High Court stays proceedings against ADGP Kumar
content: ADGP M.R. Ajith Kumar approached the High Court, challenging the Special Court’s rebuffing of the VACB preliminary inquiry report that had exonerated him from any wrongdoing in the case.

title: Mother-daughter duo killed, 9 hurt in Virar building collapse; some residents feared trapped
content: The injured have been rushed to various hospitals in the area and Nalasopara, on the outskirts of Mumbai, while firefighters and teams from the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) are conducting a rescue operation at the site.

title: Youth sentenced to life imprisonment for rape and murder of minor girl in New Town
content: The crime took place on February 6, 2025, when the class VIII student had left her home after an argument with her family members.

title: Heavy rains in Bastar, four die after car swept away
content: Bastar Superintendent of Police Shalabh Sinha told The Hindu that while the call was received on Tuesday morning, the State Disaster Response Force could only start the rescue work much later owing to the strong currents.

title: Assam Cabinet nod for streamlining inter-religious land transfer process
content: Same procedure would be followed when NGOs from outside the State seek to acquire land for establishment of educational or health institutions, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma says; local NGOs are exempt

content: Police move comes close on the heels of Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan’s suggestion that the government is on the right legal track on the issue.

title: Watch: Dowry death: The shocking story of Nikki Bhati explained
content: The brutal killing of 28-year-old Nikki Bhati in Greater Noida has shaken the nation. Married in 2016, she faced years of dowry harassment before being set ablaze, allegedly by her husband and in-laws.

title: No Durga Puja grant to clubs who have not submitted utilisation certificate: Calcutta High Court
content: The counsel appearing for the State government informed the Court that 2,876 puja committees in Kolkata have submitted utilisation reports on time and only three of the rest 41,795 committees spread across the districts have not submitted their utilisation certificate.

title: ED blocks bank accounts of people raided in Tripura
content: One of the accused is a retired staff member of the fire service, and another is a retired banker. They have been blamed for amassing a huge amount of money and property through illegal and doubtful means

content: Justice B.V. Nagarathna, member of SC Collegium, had dissented over elevation of Justice Pancholi to apex court judge

content: The run-up to the election to the Bodoland Territorial Council has never been so peaceful since the first polls in 2005

content: Yellow alert for heavy rainfall in 11 Telangana districts, with thunderstorms and gusty winds expected in all areas

content: The victim, a class 5 student, was found unconscious with critical burns in the washroom of the Girls’ Middle School within Gardani Bagh police station limits

content: “The oxygen cylinders provided by our tour operator have run out, and each new one costs around ₹3,500,” a tourist said

content: People across the globe and the country embraced Sabarimala’s core philosophy. Hence, the TDB has organised the coming together of Ayyappa devotees”, he added

content: A low-pressure area over the northwest Bay of Bengal will, however, not have any direct impact on the State, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said

content: My constitutional obligations forbid me from holding forth on such matters or any sensitive information privy to the Chief Minister. The government is on the right legal track, says Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan

content: The team secured first place in Kerala and 12th position at the national level, marking one of the most significant achievements in the institute’s motorsport journey, a press release said here on Wednesday.

title: Cabinet approves India's 2030 CWG bid, says Ahmedabad ideal host with world-class stadiums
content: India is also aiming to conduct the 2036 Olympic Games and for that too, Ahmedabad is a front-runner as the host city. The city's sporting infrastructure is being upgraded with that ambition.

title: Vedan rape case: High Court grants bail to Malayalam rapper
content: In his bail petition, Vedan had alleged that he and his managers used to get calls threatening to implicate him in such a case

title: TVK Madurai conference: Case against Vijay after cadre complains of being ‘pushed down’ by bouncers
content: The case was booked in connection with an incident at the TVK’s recent conference in Madurai, where a party cadre, who climbed the ramp and went close to Mr. Vijay, was forcefully pushed down by a bouncer

title: Heavy rains lash Telangana on August 27; CM Revanth asks Collectors to be on alert
content: Siddipet district too was pounded by showers, particularly in Gajwel, Mirudoddi, Thoguta, Dubbaka and Daultabad

title: Kerala government promulgates rules to grant unrestricted land use rights to farmers settled on assigned land
content: The law empowers the State government to regularise violations of land use norms over the decades, freeing lakhs of settler farmers from undesired litigation, red tape and governmental action

title: SCR cancels, diverts trains due to water overflowing on tracks
content: Tirupati bound Rayalaseema scheduled to leave from Nizamabad has been cancelled for the day while Kacheguda-Medak passenger was partially cancelled between Mirzapalli-Medak

title: Noida dowry death: Inflammable liquid, new video clips open up fresh angles
content: The new findings seem to mark a shift from earlier allegations that Nikki Bhati was set on fire with a flammable liquid by her husband and his family

title: Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin joins ‘Voter Adhikar Yatra’ in Bihar, says BJP has made the Election Commission a ‘puppet’
content: The Tamil Nadu Chief Minister alleged that the deletion of the names of 65 lakh voters from the electoral rolls of Bihar during the special intensive revision was "more dangerous than terrorism"

title: Rahul Gandhi cites media report on huge donations to ‘anonymous parties’ in Gujarat, asks ‘will ECI probe’
content: Mr. Gandhi, the Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha, shared on X the media report which claimed that in Gujarat, 10 anonymously registered political parties received ₹4,300 crore in donations from 2019-20 to 2023-24

title: SC Collegium proposes transfer of 14 judges across nine High Courts
content: A similar reshuffle had happened in the High Courts in May, days after Chief Justice Gavai took over as top judge

title: Bengal Governor removes Gour Banga University's V-C over dereliction of duty, corruption charges
content: The Governor’s directive came days after the university’s inspector of colleges accused the professor of demanding money to cover legal expenses

title: IMD issues red alert for heavy rains for three districts of Himachal Pradesh
content: Red alert for Chamba, Kangra, and Mandi districts; road connectivity between Mandi and Kullu remains affected as both the main highway and alternate routes are blocked

title: BJP demands ‘SIR’ within GHMC limits before local body polls
content: BJP leader Marri Shashidhar Reddy called for strict action against those who have registered in Hyderabad as voters despite belonging to other constituencies or states

title: Armed forces must be prepared for longer conflicts: Rajnath Singh
content: In an address at the ‘Ran Samvad’ at the Army War College in Mhow, Madhya Pradesh, Rajnath Singh said India does not want anyone’s land, but it is ready to go to any extent to protect its territorial integrity

title: CSIR-CCMB scientists discover novel way to expedite tissue repair and regeneration
content: The study has overturned the long-held belief that once a cell begins to die, its journey is irreversible

title: Modi-made ‘MEGA’ has become ‘MAHA headache’ for India: Congress on additional U.S. tariffs
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications, Jairam Ramesh, said the "Trump double tariff" has come into effect, which will undoubtedly hit India's labour-intensive exports to the U.S.

title: Additional 25% tariff imposed by U.S. President Trump on India comes into effect
content: Earlier, PM Modi asserted he can’t compromise on the interests of farmers, cattle-rearers, small-scale industries, cautioning “pressure on us may increase, but we will bear it”

title: Watch: Why did the government ban money-games online?
content: The Union Government has brought in a law to ban online games played with money. This is a heavy blow, to the industry that has attracted huge sums as investment, running to billions of dollars and which is said to employ a couple of lakhs of people. Why did the government bring this about?

title: SC to hear journalist's plea against Assam Police FIR over video post on August 28
content: In his plea, Mr. Sharma has challenged the validity of Section 152 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), which deals with acts endangering the sovereignty, unity and integrity of India

title: Killing of journalists in Gaza shocking: India
content: Five journalists were among at least 20 people killed in the strikes on Nasser hospital in Khan Younis

title: SpiceJet imposes 5-year flying ban on Army officer who assaulted its staff at Srinagar airport
content: The officer has been banned from taking any domestic, international or non-scheduled flights operated by the airline during this period

title: Trump again claims he stopped India-Pakistan war from ‘going nuclear’
content: The U.S. President’s latest comments came on August 26 during a cabinet meeting at the White House, where he also claimed that he had spoken with Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: 6,000 evacuated as major rivers flow above alert level in J&K; Mata Vaishno Devi landslip toll rises to 34
content: Death toll in the rain-ravaged Jammu and Kashmir rose to 41; massive damage has been reported to public infrastructure, including several key bridges, houses and commercial establishments

title: Trump tariffs updates | Secondary, tertiary effects of U.S. tariffs on economy pose challenges: Finance Ministry report
content: The Indian government is pushing a ‘Swadeshi’ mantra to reduce the economy’s reliance on exports, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi calling on Indians to be “vocal for local”

title: With Sci-Hub gone, will the ‘One Nation, One Subscription’ scheme step up?
content: Internationally, publishers such as Elsevier and Wiley have used the courtroom to buttress the legitimacy of their business model and portray shadow libraries like Alexandra Elbakyan’s Sci-Hub as rogue actors rather than as symptoms of dysfunction

title: 'Nuke India, kill Trump': Minneapolis shooter wrote chilling messages on weapons
content: Robin Westman, 23, opened fire at Annunciation Catholic Church in Minneapolis, killing two children and injuring 17. The assailant had messages like "NUKE INDIA" and others written on the weapons. Authorities are investigating the incident as domestic terrorism and a hate crime, focusing on Westman's social media posts containing violent diary entries and the fact that Westman was a former student of the school.

title: B'luru stampede: RCB breaks silence after 3 months - What the IPL champions said
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) broke their three-month social media silence to address the tragic stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium in June, which resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries. RCB acknowledged their silence stemmed from grief over the incident that occurred during their homecoming celebration after winning their first IPL title.

title: ‘Money rain’ in UP's Auraiya: Monkey snatches Rs 80,000, throws Rs 500 notes from tree
content: In a bizarre incident in Auraiya, Uttar Pradesh, a monkey snatched a bag containing Rs 80,000 from a teacher's motorcycle at Bidhuna Tehsil. The monkey then climbed a tree and began throwing the currency notes, causing a 'money rain' and a scramble among onlookers.

title: 'Vipin set her on fire’: Nikki Bhati's sister stands by her statement
content: Following Nikki Bhati's death from severe burns, the UP Women's Commission visited her family, where her sister Kanchan maintained that Nikki's husband, Vipin, set her ablaze over dowry demands. Kanchan's testimony is crucial as police investigate Vipin, his parents, and brother, all arrested for murder.

title: 15 dead in Virar building collapse; builder arrested
content: A residential building collapse in Virar East, near Mumbai, resulted in at least 13 fatalities, trapping numerous residents. Rescue operations were launched involving fire brigade, police, NDRF, and ambulance services. The Vasai Virar City Municipal Corporation (VVCMC) will recognize flat owners as having "other rights" in property records, ensuring their legal standing in property-related decisions.

title: AI researcher quits Meta: Reveals reason for exit; Says he followed Mark Zuckerberg’s advice
content: Meta's Superintelligence Lab is experiencing departures, including AI scientist Rishabh Agarwal, who left after five months despite a reported million-dollar salary, citing a desire for "a different kind of risk." Agarwal's exit follows those of other researchers, some of whom have returned to OpenAI, raising questions about Meta's ambitious superintelligence program and its ability to retain top AI talent.

title: Explained: What Tele-MANAS offers students and why CBSE wants schools to act now
content: CBSE has instructed all affiliated schools to promote the Tele-MANAS helpline, offering students 24x7 free and confidential mental health support in 20 languages. Schools must display helpline numbers and include information in assemblies and newsletters. A mobile app and video consultations are also available. Meanwhile, CBSE and AIIMS Delhi launched Project MATE, a five-day training for school counsellors focusing on adolescent well-being, resilience, and peer support as part of a broader mental health framework.

title: 'Whose life will be better if I retire?': Shami shuts down speculation, vows to keep playing
content: Dismissing retirement rumours, Mohammed Shami asserts his commitment to cricket, fueled by an unfulfilled ambition to win the ODI World Cup. Despite recent omissions from the national squad, the 34-year-old pacer vows to continue playing domestic cricket and working diligently on his fitness. Shami emphasises his enduring love for the game and determination to keep fighting until his motivation wanes.

title: This common backyard plant could be key to reversing liver damage; here's how
content: Emerging research highlights dandelion root's potential in combating liver fibrosis, a condition leading to chronic liver damage. Studies indicate that dandelion root extract can prevent the progression of hepatic fibrosis by reducing oxidative stress, inflammation, and collagen accumulation. While primarily tested on animals, these findings suggest dandelion's bioactive compounds may offer liver protection and promote tissue repair.

title: Elon Musk’s lawyers ask US judge to reject request to show chats with Zuckerberg
content: Elon Musk and Sam Altman's legal battle intensifies as Musk's lawyers attempt to block OpenAI from acquiring documents from Meta regarding an alleged $97.4 billion bid for OpenAI's assets. OpenAI claims Musk approached Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to join the bid, which Zuckerberg declined.

title: 'Too chill, no growth': Ex-Microsoft techie quits new job in 20 days; internet reacts
content: A former Microsoft engineer's abrupt departure from a new job after just 20 days has sparked widespread debate online. Citing a lack of challenge and potential for stagnation, he prioritized growth over comfort. This decision highlights the ongoing tension between ambition and work-life balance, resonating with many who value continuous development over a relaxed work environment.

title: SpaceX prodigy exits: Kairan Quazi, hired by Elon Musk at 14; after 2 years, says ‘I felt ready’
content: Kairan Quazi, formerly SpaceX's youngest employee, is transitioning to Wall Street at 16, joining Citadel Securities as a quantitative developer. He chose quant finance over AI labs for its blend of intellectual challenge and rapid feedback. Quazi's unconventional path includes skipping grades and becoming Santa Clara University's youngest graduate, showcasing his remarkable talent.

title: Gold & silver price prediction today: Gold rate exhibiting bullish trend
content: Gold and silver price prediction today:  Gold prices are expected to continue their upward trend, potentially reaching 102,450, supported by strong bullish momentum and global uncertainties. Silver is also showing strength, aiming for 117,500, driven by investment demand and industrial use.

title: Post surgeries bike ride to Kailash: What Sadhguru replied to R Madhavan's question
content: Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev, recovered from two brain surgeries in 2024, is on a motorcycle journey to Mount Kailash. Actor R Madhavan praised Sadhguru's resilience, questioning his perilous journey despite his recent subdural hematoma. Sadhguru humorously stated he put his 'broken head in Shiva's lap.' He recounted a previous health scare and how Kailash transformed him.

title: 4 youths cling to tree, escape being swept away to Pakistan
content: A dramatic rescue unfolded near the India-Pakistan border as an NDRF team saved four youngsters swept away by floodwater, clinging to a tree. Simultaneously, in Gurdaspur, around 400 students and staff were rescued from a flooded residential school. Heavy rainfall across Punjab, Haryana, and Himachal Pradesh led to widespread flooding, prompting school closures and government relief efforts.

title: Duleep Trophy: Why Jurel, Easwaran are not playing - All you need to know
content: Central Zone captain Dhruv Jurel and East Zone skipper Abhimanyu Easwaran are not playing the opening round of their respective Duleep Trophy matches in Bengaluru. In Jurel's absence, Rajat Patidar is leading Central Zone and Riyan Parag is leading East Zone.

title: 'Not about Ukraine at all': Democrats say Trump tariffs sabotaging US-India relationship
content: Democrats on the US House Foreign Affairs Committee criticized President Trump's 50% tariff on Indian goods, arguing it harms Americans and damages US-India relations. They questioned if the tariffs were truly about Ukraine, coinciding with their official implementation. New Delhi condemned the tariffs as unfair, while Trump defended them as a means to cut Russia's oil revenue.

title: CBSE reforms: New 2026 exams LOC rules for Class 10, 12; APAAR ID, dual boards introduced
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has introduced major reforms for the 2026 Class 10 and 12 board exams, revamping the List of Candidates (LOC) submission process. Key changes include a two-board exam policy for Class 10, mandatory linking of APAAR IDs for Indian schools, strict data accuracy requirements, and a dedicated portal for Children with Special Needs, enhancing transparency, inclusivity, and operational efficiency.

title: DDA Premium Housing Scheme: Who can apply, required documents; categories, auction rules explained
content: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) has launched its Premium Housing Scheme 2025, featuring an online e-auction from August 26 to September 24. This scheme offers diverse housing options, including LIG flats starting at Rs 38 lakh and HIG apartments exceeding Rs 2 crore in prime locations like Vasant Kunj and Dwarka.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 opens below 24,600; Sensex down over 400 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in opening trade on Thursday a day after 50% US tariffs came into effect on India, but recovered in mid-day trade.

title: J&K: Army foils infiltration bid along LoC in Bandipora; 2 terrorists killed
content: In a joint operation with Jammu and Kashmir Police, the Indian Army successfully thwarted an infiltration attempt along the Line of Control in the Gurez sector. Alert troops spotted and challenged the intruders, leading to a fierce exchange of fire. The operation, codenamed Naushera Nar IV, resulted in the neutralization of two terrorists, with the anti-terror operation still in progress.

title: 26 penalties! League Cup shocker as fourth-tier Grimsby Town stun Man United
content: Manchester United suffered a humiliating League Cup exit to Grimsby Town, losing 12-11 on penalties after a 2-2 draw. The League Two side prevailed after a marathon shootout, increasing pressure on United's manager, Ruben Amorim, following a poor start to the season. Grimsby celebrated a historic victory, eliminating one of United's few chances for silverware.

title: Skeletal remains near Kedarnath temple may be of T'gana student missing since Aug 2024
content: Skeletal remains discovered near Chorabari Tal, close to Kedarnath temple, are suspected to be those of Nomula Rishwanth, a Telangana student missing since August 2024. An ID card found with the remains suggests the identity, but authorities are awaiting DNA test results for confirmation. Rishwanth's family has been notified and is traveling to Kedarnath to assist with identification.

title: Another case against Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil for stalking, harassing women
content: Kerala's Crime Branch has filed a case against Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil, accusing him of stalking and harassing women on social media platforms. This action follows Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's strong condemnation of the sexual misconduct allegations against the legislator. Vijayan assured full protection to those affected and urged them to file complaints, emphasizing the seriousness of the alleged remarks.

title: Uttarakhand resort: Delhi executive raped in Lansdowne; fiance’s cousin on the run
content: A 22-year-old woman reported being raped by her fiancé's cousin at a resort near Jaiharikhal in Lansdowne while vacationing with his family. The incident occurred on Saturday evening, but was reported through the 112 helpline a couple of days later. Police have registered an FIR and are currently searching for the accused, who fled the resort after the alleged rape.

title: 'It's one of the worst': ABD shares Bronco test experience as BCCI mulls new fitness regime
content: AB de Villiers described the Bronco test, potentially being introduced to Indian cricketers by strength and conditioning coach Adrian le Roux, as a grueling fitness assessment he's familiar with since age 16. He recalled its difficulty, especially in low-oxygen conditions. Ravichandran Ashwin cautioned against sudden changes in training methods to prevent player injuries.

title: Jockey Silvestre's ex-wife charged: Victoria accused of assault; incident before big race win
content: Silvestre de Sousa's ex-wife, Victoria, faces assault charges for allegedly attacking the champion jockey in July. Prosecutors accuse the 39-year-old of wounding the 44-year-old rider with intent to cause serious harm. Despite the ongoing legal battle, Silvestre de Sousa continues his successful racing career, securing significant wins, including a victory at Yarmouth the day after the alleged incident.

title: US plans visa curbs for foreign students, professors — What’s changing
content: The Trump administration is proposing fixed admission periods for foreign students, exchange visitors, and media representatives, ending the "duration of status" policy to curb visa abuse and enhance oversight. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick announced plans for a "gold card" initiative for wealthy investors and H-1B visa program changes.

title: Vaishno Devi tragedy: CM questions decision to continue yatra despite weather warnings; 41 dead so far
content: Following a deadly landslide near the Vaishno Devi shrine that claimed 34 lives, former CM Omar Abdullah questioned why the pilgrimage wasn't halted despite weather warnings. Record rainfall caused widespread flooding and infrastructure damage across Jammu and Kashmir, prompting evacuations and disrupted communication. LG Manoj Sinha reviewed relief efforts, announcing compensation for victims and ordering essential services restoration.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha recommends Nykaa, Kaynes, and Dr Reddy's Laboratories as top stock picks for today. Nifty faces potential downside, targeting 24500/24350, while Bank Nifty may test sub-54000 levels.

title: 'Coolie' box office collections day 15: Rajinikanth’s actioner crosses Rs 269 crore
content: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, has grossed Rs 269.81 crore net in India after 15 days, marking a significant opening but experiencing mixed momentum. The film started strong with Rs 65 crore on its first day and Rs 229.65 crore in its first week, but collections sharply declined in the second week despite star-studded cast and Lokesh's direction.

title: US Open: Novak Djokovic breaks Roger Federer’s Grand Slam record, eyes more history
content: Novak Djokovic secured his place in the US Open third round for a record-breaking 19th time, surpassing Roger Federer's milestone with his 75th Grand Slam third-round appearance. Despite a slow start and admitting he's not at his peak, Djokovic battled through to defeat Zachary Svajda in four sets.

title: Luka Doncic gets surprise from Jeanie Buss & Rob Pelinka ahead of EuroBasket game
content: Los Angeles Lakers' Jeanie Buss and Rob Pelinka visited Luka Doncic in Poland. They showed support before EuroBasket. Doncic signed a big extension with the Lakers. The Lakers see him as the future leader. Doncic is in great shape after losing weight. He is ready to lead Slovenia in the tournament. Other NBA stars will also compete.

title: Minneapolis church shooting: Trump orders flag at half mast; FBI begins hate crime probe
content: Following a tragic mass shooting at a Minneapolis church on August 27, which claimed the lives of two students and injured 17 others, President Trump has ordered flags to be flown at half-staff. The FBI is investigating the incident, led by Director Kash Patel, as both an act of domestic terrorism and a hate crime targeting the Catholic community.

title: 'War 2' box office: Hrithik, NTR & Kiara starrer fails to pick pace; ends week with Rs 229 cr haul
content: War 2, starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, has completed its second week with underwhelming box office performance. Despite the Ganesh Chaturthi holiday, collections remained stagnant, with an estimated Rs 2.50 crore net on Wednesday. The film's total stands at Rs 229.5 crore net in India and Rs 347.

title: Hailee Steinfeld vs Josh Allen: Viral fan moment in Buffalo; actress steals the spotlight
content: Hailee Steinfeld, wife of Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen, made a fan's day at Fan Expo Canada. She joined a fan in a heart gesture, creating a viral moment. This act reinforced the bond between the Allen family and Bills Mafia. It also amplified Josh Allen's marketability. Such moments humanize celebrities and boost team momentum.

title: Michael Jordan donated $8.9M to kids after 2015 lawsuit win
content: Michael Jordan won an $8.9 million lawsuit against Dominick's in 2015 for unauthorized use of his name in an advertisement. He donated the entire settlement to 23 Chicago charities supporting children's health, education, and well-being. This case highlights Jordan's commitment to protecting his identity and giving back to the community.

title: Syko Stu hospitalised: Awake and recovering after LA beating; Raja Jackson blamed
content: Stuart 'Syko Stu' Smith is recovering after Raja Jackson's attack in Los Angeles. Douglas Malo intervened and updated on Smith's condition. Smith remembers the day and is talking, but has facial injuries. The Los Angeles Police Department is investigating Raja Jackson. A GoFundMe page for Smith's medical bills has raised over $150,000. MrBeast and Chris Jericho are among the donors.

title: Travis Kelce engagement: Stars react to Taylor Swift news; celeb responses you must see
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's engagement has triggered a massive celebration across Hollywood and the internet. Celebrities like Lil Wayne, who paused his concert, and Justin Bieber, who offered congratulations, joined the chorus of well-wishers. Swift's close friends and collaborators, including Jack Antonoff and Cara Delevingne, also shared their excitement, solidifying the engagement as a major cultural moment.

title: Visa shake-up: US plans four-year cap; grace period cut for students
content: The United States Department of Homeland Security plans to change visa rules. The new rules impact students, exchange visitors, and foreign media representatives. Currently, these visa holders can stay indefinitely. The proposed change sets a maximum four-year stay for students and exchange visitors. Media representatives get a 240-day limit. Officials say this will reduce fraud and improve oversight.

title: Leon Draisaitl leaves 3-word comment in German as Derek Ryan bids farewell to Edmonton Oilers
content: Leon Draisaitl lauded Derek Ryan as "incredible" after Ryan's four-year stint with the Edmonton Oilers concluded. Ryan, who confirmed his departure via Instagram, expressed gratitude to the city and its fans. Draisaitl's German comment highlighted the strong bond and Ryan's significant influence within the Oilers' locker room during his tenure as a reliable two-way center.

title: India May Become 2nd-Largest Economy With $34.2 Trillion GDP By 2038: Report
content: The Indian economy is projected to reach $20.7 trillion by 2030 and potentially $34.2 trillion by 2038, according to the August 2025 edition of EY Economy Watch.

title: 10-Year-Old Survives After Friend Takes Bullet At Minneapolis Catholic School
content: A 10-year-old boy survived the deadly shooting at the Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis, thanks to his friend who took the bullet for him.

title: "Modi's War": Trump's Advisor Claims India Linked To Russia-Ukraine Conflict
content: Hours after US President Donald Trump's crippling 50 per cent tariff on India came into effect, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro labelled the Russia-Ukraine conflict "Modi's war."

title: Breaking Bad, Guns, Suicide Note: US Man's Video Before Mass Shooting
content: One of the videos, running approximately 11 minutes, begins with an image instantly recognisable to television audiences -- a black-and-white sketch of Heisenberg, the alter ego of Walter White from Breaking Bad.

title: PM Modi, Xi Bilateral Likely During PM's First Visit To China In 7 Years
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping are likely to hold a bilateral meeting during PM Modi's first visit to China in seven years.

title: Sensex Drops 600 Points, Nifty Down 180 Amid US Tariffs On Indian Goods
content: Nifty and Sensex each fell about 1% on Tuesday, their sharpest single-day percentage drop in three months, before the US tariffs took effect.

title: South Korea Passes Bill Banning Mobile Phones In School Classrooms
content: South Korea has passed a bill banning the use of mobile phones in school classrooms nationwide, officials said Thursday, joining other countries in efforts to curb social media use among minors.

title: "Has Become Total Scam": Republican Governor Slams India Over H-1B Visas
content: Amid US President Donald Trump's continued crackdown on immigration, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis labelled the H-1B -- the skilled foreign workers visa-- a "total scam", claiming it allows companies to hire cheaper foreign labour from India.

title: Putin, Kim Jong Un To Attend China's "Victory Day" Parade On September 26
content: Foreign leaders including Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un will attend a massive military parade in Beijing marking the formal surrender of Japan during World War II, according to the Chinese foreign ministry.

title: 2 Microsoft Workers Fired After Protesting Ties To Israel
content: A Microsoft spokesperson said the workers were terminated following "serious breaches of company policies and our code of conduct" stemming from "the break-in at the executive offices."

title: Adani Portfolio EBITDA Crosses Rs 90,000 Crore For 1st Time
content: The Adani Portfolio EBITDA reached Rs 90,572 crore on a trailing 12-month basis for the first time -- up 10 per cent year-on-year -- with Q1 FY26 EBITDA also reaching a record high at Rs 23,793 crore, the Adani Group said on Thursday.

title: Kerala Actor Lakshmi Menon, Accused Of Kidnapping, Assaulting Techie, Gets Protection From Arrest
content: Kerala High Court has granted interim protection from arrest to actress Lakshmi R Menon until September 17.

title: Centre Extends Duty-Free Imports Of Cotton By 3 Months Till December 31
content: The government on Thursday extended duty-free import of cotton by three more months till December 31 to support textile exporters facing steep 50 per cent tariffs in the US.

title: Trump Administration Proposes New Visa Restrictions For Students, Journalists
content: The Trump administration aims to tighten the duration of visas for students, cultural exchange visitors and members of the media, according to a proposed government regulation issued on Wednesday, part of a broader crackdown on legal immigration.

title: 20 Delhi Colleges Receive Bomb Threats, Search Ops Underway
content: A fresh wave of bomb threat emails has hit the national capital, with around 20 colleges, including Jesus and Mary College in Chanakyapuri, receiving threatening messages, according to the Delhi Fire Services (DFS).

title: Kerala Man Duped Of Rs 95,000 After Contacting Bogus Toll-Free Number
content: A 52-year-old man from this southern Kerala district lost Rs 95,000 after being duped by cyber fraudsters while trying to service his water purifier after contacting an online toll-free number, police said on Thursday.

title: Fake Marriage Racket Busted In Bihar, 4 "Brides" Among 9 Arrested
content: Nine people have been arrested in Bihar for running a sophisticated marriage fraud operation, where women posed as brides to swindle victims out of money and valuables.

title: "Hurting Americans": US Democrats Panel Slams Trump Over India Tariffs
content: The Democrats' US House Foreign Affairs Committee has slammed President Donald Trump and his administration for singling out India over its purchase of Russian oil, even as China-- one of Moscow's largest crude exporters-- faces no such penalties.

title: 2K Games details MyNBA and MyGM changes in upcoming NBA 2K26
content: 2K Games has revealed improvements to NBA 2K26's management modes, MyNBA and MyGM . players can invite up to 15 friends or make the playoffs available to the public . most actions in these modes are simulated, and developers have invested time and energy in response to community feedback .

content: a collaboration with his brand Tru Kolors and American Eagle will feature six athletes from across the sports world . the collection will feature more than 90 pieces . it's been a busy week for tight end Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift .

title: How Kalen DeBoer looks to make things right in Year 2 at Alabama
content: "it was basically the elephant in the room," says a team meeting . "if you don't want to be here, leave," says the team's head strength coach . a meeting in which coach David Ballou spared nobody in an earsplitting tirade .

content: the 2025 WNBA playoff picture is taking shape . the top teams in the league are fighting for playoff seeding and home-court advantage . five teams, all within four games of each other, are realistically vying for the final three spots .

content: the Chiefs star tight end is in the final year of his contract . he has spoken about his future with the team through only this season . "i can't go out like that," he says . the chiefs start their season in so Paulo next week .

title: Catch up on NFL cuts, trades and final roster moves
content:
C.J. Stroud joins "First Take" to discuss how the Texans' offensive line has improved as a unit to protect him better in the 2025 NFL season. (1:13) The roster  cut-down deadline  for all  32 teams  for the  2025 NFL season  has passed. Each front office had to trim its active roster to 53 players by 4 p.m. ET, which means there were plenty of cuts, trades, practice squad additions and  roster moves  announced. Good news: We tracked it all for you. Here is the intel, including notable moves and what our reporters heard. There will be no more updates. Quick links:
